 They talk like that to get attention, and to show it's not broadcast frag=
ments. Some think cussing negative, but I think it's pretty good evidence. =
What about the voice a few seconds later that says "Kinda frightful in that=
 way--We hope they believe it", it's meant to prove the voices, not just to=
 be cute. 
 
 A probelm I'm having is this stuff doesn't fit the paranormal=
 paradigm of most. Could it be that most paranormal "knowledge" is adultera=
ted. 
 
 
 
 Frank


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: lisby@...=
te: Tue, 16 Oct 2007 12:07:53 -0400Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The rest of the d=
ing file

Thanks! No,that right off the broadcast AM here i=
n Denver.


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: lisby@...: Mon, =
15 Oct 2007 18:05:47 -0400Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The rest of the ding file
=


I clearly hear the voice, Frank. No chance you're using Asian porn as a s=
ound source, huh? ;) 

Ann


On Oct 15, 2007, at 2:38 PM, Tracy wrote:




=
I just got the chance to listen to it Frank!  The first part I didn't hear =
too clear, but the 'make a fuckin ding" that was CLEAR as a bell and you're=
 right, that isn't something they would play on the radio.  The rest of it =
I could hear clear too, I just had a hard time hearing the very first part,=
 but that one part was so  clear I was like wow wow! Frank Sumption <franks=
-boxes@...> wrote:


 Same old story, get a voice that should be ex=
tra-ordinary, and not one friggin' comment. I was wondering over the weeken=
d if I've spent enough time on this. The boxes produce little that anyone s=
eems to hear, and if it's too clear, I'm sure some, or maybe many don't bel=
ieve it. I guess it has to be that whispery s--- that you have to filter in=
to oblivion to be a "true" EVP, and I think that's what most are listening =
for, it has to fit the paradigm of current ghost hunting knowledge, or it's=
 rejected. I've reached a point where I'm tired of working on something tha=
t seems so pointless. What if what I hear think I hear is only my own mis-p=
erceptions!?   Frank-S
